thread.section_title: Politics - Crain's New York Business News Feed
thread.title: Boehner's presumptive successor drops speaker bid
thread.title_full: Boehner's presumptive successor drops speaker bid

author: Bloomberg News
title: Boehner's presumptive successor drops speaker bid
text:
October 8, 2015 Updated 10/08/2015 Boehner's presumptive successor drops speaker bid Amid speculation he couldn't get the necessary 218 House votes, House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy dropped out of the election. By Bloomberg News × Boehner postponed the vote for speaker of the house on Tuesday 
House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy dropped out of the race for U.S. House speaker on the day his party was poised to nominate him to replace John Boehner, lawmakers said. 
Mr. Boehner, who is leaving Congress at the end of the month, postponed the election that was to have been held by House Republicans Thursday afternoon. The full House is scheduled to vote for speaker Oct. 29. 
Representative Peter King of New York told reporters that Mr. McCarthy’s announcement during a meeting of House Republicans left everyone “absolutely stunned.” It had become clear that the caucus needed to be united and “he’s not the one” to do it, Mr. King said. 
Representative Charlie Dent of Pennsylvania told CNN that while Mr. McCarthy could have won the nomination within the conference he probably wouldn’t have been able to get the 218 votes he needed in the full House.
